workflow.name: Instant competitor product launch monitor with Bright Data & OpenAI to email/sheets
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This workflow automatically monitors competitor product launches across news sites, press releases, and social channels. It saves you hours of manual tracking and ensures your team is instantly alerted when a rival announces something new.

## Overview

The automation regularly scrapes predefined sources for mentions of your competitors combined with launch-related keywords. Bright Data provides reliable scraping, while OpenAI analyzes each article to extract key details (product name, features, launch date, pricing). Summaries are pushed to Slack and logged in Google Sheets so your marketing and product teams can react quickly.

## Tools Used

- **n8n** ‚Äì Orchestrates the entire workflow
- **Bright Data** ‚Äì Scrapes news, blogs, and social posts without blocks
- **OpenAI** ‚Äì Extracts and summarizes launch information
- **Slack** ‚Äì Sends real-time alerts to a chosen channel
- **Google Sheets** ‚Äì Creates a searchable launch database

## How to Install

1. **Import the Workflow**: Upload the provided `.json` to your n8n instance.
2. **Configure Bright Data**: Add your Bright Data credentials in the MCP Client node.
3. **Set Up OpenAI**: Enter your OpenAI API key.
4. **Connect Slack & Google Sheets**: Authorize both services and choose the target channel / spreadsheet.
5. **Customize Sources**: Edit the list of competitor domains and launch keywords in the initial Set node.

## Use Cases

- **Product Marketing**: Track rival announcements to refine positioning.
- **Sales Enablement**: Equip reps with up-to-date competitive intel.
- **Competitive Intelligence**: Maintain a historical log of launches for trend analysis.
- **Investor Relations**: Stay informed of market movements that affect valuation.

## Connect with Me

- **Website**: https://www.nofluff.online
- **YouTube**: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
- **Get Bright Data**: https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #competitiveintelligence #productlaunch #brightdata #webscraping #openai #slackalerts #n8nworkflow #nocode #marketintel

parameters.subject: =üÜï New Product Review: {{ $json.title }}

parameters.content:
## üî∂ **SECTION 1: Schedule & Scrape Target Configuration**

üß© **Nodes:**

* ‚è∞ `Daily Check (7AM)`
* üõ† `Set Scrape Target (Verge Reviews)`

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

This section controls **when** and **what** to scrape.

#### ‚è∞ `Schedule Trigger`

* Automatically runs the workflow **every morning at 7AM**.
* No manual checking needed!

#### üõ† `Edit Fields`

* Sets the target scraping page:
  `https://www.theverge.com/reviews`
* You can easily switch this to other competitor sites (like TechCrunch or Wired) later.

---

### üí° Why it matters:

This is where you **customize your intelligence source**. Just change the URL or keyword once ‚Äî no coding needed.

---

## ü§ñ **SECTION 2: Agent-Powered Scraping with Bright Data**

üß© **Node:**

* ü§ñ `Bright Data Scraper Agent`
  üîó Sub-nodes:
* üîÆ OpenAI Chat Model
* üß© MCP Client (Bright Data Tool)
* üì¶ Structured Output Parser

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

This is the **heart of the automation** ‚Äî using a powerful AI agent connected to Bright Data‚Äôs scraping infrastructure.

#### ü§ñ `AI Agent`

* Uses an **OpenAI agent** that understands your instructions.
* Connects to **Bright Data MCP** to bypass anti-bot systems and extract clean product data.
* Scrapes:

  * üì¶ Product Title
  * üìÖ Release Date
  * üìù Short Summary
  * üîó URL (relative, so we'll fix that later)

#### üì¶ `Structured Output Parser`

* Parses the AI agent‚Äôs response into structured JSON ‚Äî ready for automation.

---

### üí° Why it matters:

Even a beginner can now use **AI + Bright Data** to scrape dynamic sites that normally block scrapers.

---

## ‚úâÔ∏èüìä **SECTION 4: Notify & Log the Insights**

üß© **Nodes:**

* ‚úâÔ∏è `Email R&D: Product Alerts`
* üìÑ `Log to Google Sheet (Review History)`

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

Now that the data is cleaned and structured, we act on it:

#### ‚úâÔ∏è Gmail Node

* Sends **one beautiful email per product** to the R\&D team.
* Contains:

  * Product title
  * Release date
  * Summary
  * Link to full article
* Uses HTML formatting for clarity.

#### üìÑ Google Sheets Node

* Appends each product to a sheet.
* Serves as a **history log** to:

  * Track past launches
  * Prevent duplicate alerts
  * Enable analysis later

---

### üí° Why it matters:

Your R\&D team gets **instant alerts** about what competitors are launching ‚Äî and you get a **central record** to refer to anytime.

---

# üõ†Ô∏è Monitor Competitor Product Launches (The Verge)

> üîÑ Automated n8n workflow using Bright Data MCP to scrape reviews & notify R\&D team

---

## üî∂ **SECTION 1: Schedule & Scrape Target Configuration**

üß© **Nodes:**

* ‚è∞ `Daily Check (7AM)`
* üõ† `Set Scrape Target (Verge Reviews)`

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

This section controls **when** and **what** to scrape.

#### ‚è∞ `Schedule Trigger`

* Automatically runs the workflow **every morning at 7AM**.
* No manual checking needed!

#### üõ† `Edit Fields`

* Sets the target scraping page:
  `https://www.theverge.com/reviews`
* You can easily switch this to other competitor sites (like TechCrunch or Wired) later.

---

### üí° Why it matters:

This is where you **customize your intelligence source**. Just change the URL or keyword once ‚Äî no coding needed.

---

## ü§ñ **SECTION 2: Agent-Powered Scraping with Bright Data**

üß© **Node:**

* ü§ñ `Bright Data Scraper Agent`
  üîó Sub-nodes:
* üîÆ OpenAI Chat Model
* üß© MCP Client (Bright Data Tool)
* üì¶ Structured Output Parser

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

This is the **heart of the automation** ‚Äî using a powerful AI agent connected to Bright Data‚Äôs scraping infrastructure.

#### ü§ñ `AI Agent`

* Uses an **OpenAI agent** that understands your instructions.
* Connects to **Bright Data MCP** to bypass anti-bot systems and extract clean product data.
* Scrapes:

  * üì¶ Product Title
  * üìÖ Release Date
  * üìù Short Summary
  * üîó URL (relative, so we'll fix that later)

#### üì¶ `Structured Output Parser`

* Parses the AI agent‚Äôs response into structured JSON ‚Äî ready for automation.

---

### üí° Why it matters:

Even a beginner can now use **AI + Bright Data** to scrape dynamic sites that normally block scrapers.

---

## üßæ **SECTION 3: Split & Format Each Review**

üß© **Node:**

* üßæ `Split & Format Each Review`

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

This Code Node takes the array of product reviews and **splits them into one item each**.

#### Code Features:

* Converts relative URLs to full links (e.g., `/xyz` ‚Üí `https://www.theverge.com/xyz`)
* Outputs 10 clean JSON objects, one per review.

```javascript
return items.map(review => {
  return {
    json: {
      title: review.title,
      url: "https://www.theverge.com" + review.url,
      release_date: review.release_date,
      summary: review.summary
    }
  };
});
```

---

### üí° Why it matters:

This lets you send **individual emails** and store **individual entries** ‚Äî great for reporting, filtering, and team alerts.

---

## ‚úâÔ∏èüìä **SECTION 4: Notify & Log the Insights**

üß© **Nodes:**

* ‚úâÔ∏è `Email R&D: Product Alerts`
* üìÑ `Log to Google Sheet (Review History)`

---

### üß† What‚Äôs Happening:

Now that the data is cleaned and structured, we act on it:

#### ‚úâÔ∏è Gmail Node

* Sends **one beautiful email per product** to the R\&D team.
* Contains:

  * Product title
  * Release date
  * Summary
  * Link to full article
* Uses HTML formatting for clarity.

#### üìÑ Google Sheets Node

* Appends each product to a sheet.
* Serves as a **history log** to:

  * Track past launches
  * Prevent duplicate alerts
  * Enable analysis later

---

### üí° Why it matters:

Your R\&D team gets **instant alerts** about what competitors are launching ‚Äî and you get a **central record** to refer to anytime.

---

## üéØ Final Thoughts

Even if you‚Äôre a complete beginner:

* You don‚Äôt need to write code (just paste small pieces).
* You‚Äôre scraping dynamic sites legally & cleanly via Bright Data.
* You‚Äôre using AI + n8n to automate competitive intelligence.

---
